title: Firefighters tackle raging inferno on Welsh mountainside amid fears massive blaze could threaten homes
text:
News Firefighters tackle raging inferno on Welsh mountainside amid fears massive blaze could threaten homes Crews were called to the blaze on Penrhys mountain in Tonypandy, Rhondda, south Wales, this afternoon as flames sweep across the mountain Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Huge fire is rages on a mountainside in the Rhondda Share this video Get daily   Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Firefighters are tackling a massive blaze on a mountainside in Wales. 
Crews were called to the blaze on Penrhys mountain in Tonypandy, Rhondda, south Wales, this afternoon as flames sweep across the mountain. 
The blaze is just hundreds of yards from nearby houses and homeowners have voiced fears about the rapid spread of the fire. 
One onlooker told Wales Online : "It's so close to our houses. Read More Flames are raging just hundreds of yards from homes Firefighters are tackling the flames Homeowners have voiced fears over the spread of the blaze 
“It’s across a large area, I saw a helicopter flying over and there are a couple of fire engines there. 
“It stretches across the whole mountain. I would say it is about twice the size of Asda, it’s massive. 
"There is a lot of smoke and it seems to be spreading quite a lot with the wind It’s very close to houses too. It’s blowing toward mine. I’m really worried.” Read More This was the inferno firefighters were confronted with when they were called to a mountain in Tonypandy , Rhondda 
South Wales Fire Service confirmed they had been called to the mountain on Saturday. 
A spokeswoman said: “There is a huge fire we’re trying to put out."
